Posts.Content: Hello Cathy I'm glad you are able to obtain your supplies, makes the whole process a little more bearable. I did have a few hot flushes but they seem to have gone now - I've been on L for 5 months now.  I had arthritis before and don't think my aches and pains are any worse.  The only big SE I've had is a reduced appetite and taste which is something I never thought I would have!  I've lost 1 and half stone but the hospital didn't think that was too bad!  I'm happy as I had fought for a long time to loose some weight but don't want to loose too much more.  Christmas goodies helped a bit, and hopefully SEs will diminish.  The other one I developed was excessive saliva.  This again has improved thankfully.  My Onco doc hadn't heard of it being a SE of Letrozole! All good wishes for 2019 xx
Posts.Title: battle of the letrozole brands

Posts.Content: Hello Cathy I'm glad you are able to obtain your supplies, makes the whole process a little more bearable. I did have a few hot flushes but they seem to have gone now - I've been on L for 5 months now.  I had arthritis before and don't think my aches and pains are any worse.  The only big SE I've had is a reduced appetite and taste which is something I never thought I would have!  I've lost 1 and half stone but the hospital didn't think that was too bad!  I'm happy as I had fought for a long time to loose some weight but don't want to loose too much more.  Christmas goodies helped a bit, and hopefully SEs will diminish.  The other one I developed was excessive saliva.  This again has improved thankfully.  My Onco doc hadn't heard of it being a SE of Letrozole! Posts.Title: battle of the letrozole brands

Posts.Content: I've been on Dr Reddys for nearly 7 months now and I don't seem to suffer from SEs too much.  I already had arthritis and back pain and they are no worse at the moment.  I did have depression quite bad when I started taking them, and still get bouts now and again, but I am just about managing it. My 93 year old mum has just been prescribed Letrozole and has been given a pack of Dr Reddys and a pack of Manx Healthcare!     I'm wondering how she will get on with them!
Posts.Title: battle of the letrozole brands

Posts.Content: I've been on Dr Reddys for nearly 7 months now and I don't seem to suffer from SEs too much.  I already had arthritis and back pain and they are no worse at the moment.  I did have depression quite bad when I started taking them, and still get bouts now and again, but I am just about managing it. My 93 year old mum has just been prescribed Letrozole and has been given a pack of Dr Reddys and a pack of Manx Healthcare!     I'm wondering how she will get on with them!
Posts.Title: battle of the letrozole brands

Posts.Content: Hello All Does anyone else take Dr Reddy's brand?  I was given this by hospital pharmacy and decided to stick with it as the SE didn't seem to effect me too much, and didn't want to run the risk of changing to another brand that gave me worse SEs.   It proved difficult to track down a local pharmacy who could/would stock it for me, but eventually I did and they get it on 'special' order for me.  My GP also agreed to write on my repeat prescriptions that I was to have this brand.  I have been told a few times that it is very expensive.  If this is so, why is it handed out in the first place?    I did ask my oncologist but he didn't know!     A very happy new year, and lots of love to all xx
Posts.Title: battle of the letrozole brands

Posts.Content: Hello All.   I start RT on 13th for 3 weeks, and have been using Aveeno blue twice a day for a couple of weeks - hope starting early helps.      I'm trying to drink as much water/squash as I can but am getting so fed up with it.   I've just finished chemo but have still got metallic taste and excessive saliva.    Could be worse!   Onwards & upwards and all that.   Lots of love and good luck to all x J
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Morning Everyone.   I have my first zap this afto and I'm very apprehensive.   I've been slapping on the Aveeno for last 3 weeks so hope that helps.    I've also got a Herceptin jab later so hope I won't feel too bad.     Love to all fellow rappers J xx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Thank you Leolady 56.    I see I typed 'rappers' instead of 'zappers' !!       Yes hopefully the next 3 weeks will go by very quickly. Lots of love to all  J xx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: You bleep on Tulip 16, I've yet to start my Rad so very interesting to see what effects people are getting. Do hope things get better for you very soon. Love J
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ June 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hello I'm new here too.    I don't actually start my radio til 13th July so shouldn't have posted here really, but was very interested to see what people were saying and tips etc.   I'm in the middle of my chemo - Pac - which has been going fairly well - had to miss a few due to low bloods - but getting there slowly.  Hair gone, eyelashes going, eyebrows hanging on!       Had my radio planning appt this week which went well.  So interested to hear about keeping hydrated and using Aveena which I have seen in the shops.  Will definitely invest in some.  Got a parking ticket which will help with the cost a little.   Getting this planned has given me a small boost, seeing a light at the end of the tunnel now.    Been very low at times what with tiredness and hoping it won't be too bad with the radio.    I know I'm one of the lucky ones though. So onwards and upwards.   Lots of love, and hugs to all
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ June 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Thank you so much for the info.   I have been using Aloe Vera gel on my scars which does seem to be helping.  Will def get the blue Aveeno and follow your advice. Many thanks, all good wishes x
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ June 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Thank you so much for the advise and kind thoughts.  All very much appreciated. Thinking of you, and sending warm wishes to all fellow friends J xx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ June 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hello Taralou.   I'm sorry to hear what you went through.  Had my second today. Got there early but was kept waiting about 20 mins with no apology.  Then went in to find one of the radiographers was a young male.   Bit of a shock as I  was expecting the ladies I had seen on Friday!   Came out with only a few minutes left on my car park pass!     This all sounds very minor to your problems now I've written it down Taralou ,  and I do hope things improve for you. Take care J x
Posts.Title: Not 'lined up' No RT today - anyone else have this?
